title: Lunar Ice Mapping
summary: Mapping water ice deposits in permanently shadowed regions on the Moon using radar and thermal sensing.
details: This research combines radar reflectometry and thermal imaging to locate and quantify water ice in permanently shadowed regions on the lunar poles. Results inform future landing site selection and in-situ resource utilization planning.

title: Mars Dust Transport
summary: Studying dust lifting and transport mechanisms on Mars to improve rover longevity and atmospheric models.
details: High-resolution simulations and field measurements from orbiters and landers help characterize how dust is lifted and transported across different seasons and terrains on Mars. This work improves cleaning strategies for solar arrays and refines climate models.

title: Astrobiology Biosignatures
summary: Searching for biosignatures in extreme environments and developing detection instruments.
details: Laboratory simulation of extreme planetary environments identifies potential molecular biosignatures. The project also prototypes miniaturized spectrometers suited for lander missions.
